result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Chelsey V Orvis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the two or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.

Counseling/assessment as deemed appropriate by PO.
Court finds defendant is entitled to jail credit if revoked. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chelsey V Orvis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Chelsey V Orvis
Current: 425 N 75th Ave, Wausau, WI 54401-4369 United States  (Effective: 09-09-2016)
Prior: 3409 Wildwood Ln, Wausau, WI 54401
Review hearing on June 3, 2016 at 10:45 am.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (includes 13CM1568, 13CM1569, filed in 13CF350)
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement on count one (diversion program)

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:47 am 
INCLUDES 13CM1568, 13CM1569, AND 14CF350.
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Andrew Morgan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 13CM1568: Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 13CM1569: Ct. 1 (DC)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF350: Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 13CM1568: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft)>>GUILTY. 
In 13CM1569: Ct. 2 (Resisting an Officer)>>GUILTY. 
In 14CF350: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, def guilty. 
COURT defers entry of judgment on Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine) in 14CF350. 
Atty Morgan makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: In 14CF350 on Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>> DEOJ for 2 years with conditions as outlined in written agreement. State notes if def successfully completes DEOJ agreement, it will move to dismiss the charge. 

COURT ORDERS: In 13CM1568 - Ct. 1 (Retail Theft), in 13CM1569 - Ct. 2 (Resisting an Officer), and in 14CF350 - Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: AODA; counseling/assessment as deemed appropriate by PO; absolute sobriety; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; payment of court costs. 

COURT finds the deft is entitled to 49 days jail credit on all if revoked. 
Review of DEOJ in 14CF350 set for June 3, 2016 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 JA. 
State requests bond in 14CF350 be amended to signature bond. 
COURT amends bond to signature bond in 14CF350 and eliminates day report element of bond and any other conditions of bond that are in conflict with probation. 
Adj: 11:12 am

Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 if this has not already been done.   No contact with T.A., A.B., & D.B. (ALL co-defendant(s) or P.J., Kohls Dept Store. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  *Court eliminates any bond condition(s) in conflict with probation.
Plea hearing on June 4, 2014 at 10:45 am.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Clere Cheree 
Case Called: 9:55am
State appears by ADA K.Mayo for C.Minder; Deft appears in person/ in custody and with Atty Andrew Morgan.
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  

Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be filed with same charges as complaint and parties ready to proceed to ARGN today.
W/R
PLEA: NOT GUILTY
Bond:  Continued

C: Br. 3

Adj: 10:02am
